title: Thai Basil Chicken Stir-Fry
description: If you have never made this at home, you are missing out - it’s fast and flavour-packed.
instructions: Mix the sauce ingredients together in a small bowl and set aside.
Heat 2 tbsp of oil in a hot wok, then add the chicken and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes until it starts to brown.
Add the garlic and chillies, and cook for another 2 minutes until fragrant.
Pour in the sauce and chicken stock. Stir-fry until it thickens and coats the chicken (about 2-3 minutes).
Toss through the Thai basil and extra chilly if you like. Cook just until the basil wilts.
Serve hot with steamed rice and a crispy fried egg on the top.

title: Spicy Honey Garlic Tofu
description: Crispy cornstarch-coated tofu tossed in a sticky, sweet, and spicy gochujang glaze. Even meat-lovers won't miss the chicken with this one!
instructions: Pat the tofu cubes completely dry with paper towels (moisture is the enemy of crispiness).
In a large bowl, season tofu with salt, pepper, and garlic powder. Sprinkle with cornstarch and toss until evenly coated.
Heat oil in a wok or large pan over medium-high heat. Fry tofu in a single layer for 2-3 minutes per side until golden and crisp. Drain on a wire rack.
Remove most oil from the pan, leaving about 1 tbsp. Sauté minced garlic for 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add honey, gochujang, brown sugar, soy sauce, and hot water. Simmer until the sauce thickens enough to coat the back of a spoon.
Add the crispy tofu back to the pan and toss quickly to glaze every piece. Garnish with scallions and sesame seeds if desired.

title: Shrimp Yaki Udon
description: Chewy udon noodles tossed with plump shrimp and a savory, umami-rich stir-fry sauce. A 15-minute weeknight hero.
instructions: Prepare the udon noodles according to package instructions (usually soaking in hot water for 2 mins), then drain and set aside.
In a small bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, oyster sauce, mirin, and dark soy sauce.
Heat oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat. Sear the shrimp until pink and just cooked through. Remove and set aside.
In the same pan, stir-fry the onion, carrots, and cabbage for 2-3 minutes until slightly softened but still vibrant.
Add the garlic and cooked udon noodles. Pour the sauce over the noodles and toss vigorously over high heat to emulsify.
Add the shrimp back in, toss for another 30 seconds until the sauce coats everything evenly, and serve immediately.

title: Baked Halloumi with Fennel and Carob Syrup
description: A wonderful combination of salty halloumi, aniseedy fennel, and the deep, honey-like sweetness of carob syrup.

ingredients.item: Fennel bulbs, trimmed and sliced into 1cm wedges

instructions: Preheat the oven to 220°C (425°F).
Toss the fennel wedges with 2 tbsp of olive oil, salt, and pepper. Spread on a baking tray and roast for 15-20 minutes until softened and charred.
Place the halloumi slices on top of the roasted fennel.
In a small bowl, whisk together the remaining olive oil, carob syrup, lemon juice, dried oregano, and chilli flakes.
Drizzle the dressing over the halloumi and fennel.
Bake for another 5-8 minutes until the halloumi is golden and bubbly. Serve warm.

title: Marinated and Pan-Fried Tofu
description: A simple yet incredibly flavorful vegan dish: tofu marinated in soy sauce, maple syrup, and spices, then pan-fried until golden. Perfect even for those who think they don’t like tofu!
instructions: Drain the tofu and pat it dry with paper towels, then cut it into cubes or slices.
In a bowl, mix soy sauce, maple syrup, vinegar, oil, and all the spices.
Add the tofu to the marinade and gently toss to coat evenly.
Let marinate for at least 1 hour (less if using a vacuum container).
Heat a non-stick pan over medium-high heat and add the tofu with its marinade.
Pan-fry until the tofu is golden and the sauce slightly caramelized.
Serve immediately, on its own or with vegetables or rice.

title: Korean Braised Tofu (Dubu-jorim)
description: A super quick and naturally vegan Korean tofu dish. Crispy pan-fried tofu simmered in a spicy, savory soy-based sauce with garlic, sesame, and gochugaru. Simple, bold, and incredibly satisfying.
instructions: Cut the tofu into thick squares and pat dry with a kitchen towel.
Finely chop the garlic and spring onions. Mix them in a bowl with water, soy sauce, sugar, gochugaru, and sesame seeds to make the sauce.
Heat oil in a pan over medium heat and fry the tofu until crispy and golden on both sides.
Add the sliced onion (if using) and pour in the sauce.
Cover with a lid and let simmer for 5–10 minutes, allowing the tofu to absorb the sauce.
Finish by drizzling with toasted sesame oil.
Serve hot with rice or as desired.

title: Deep-Fried Honey Lemon Garlic Chicken
description: Make crispy, juicy Honey Lemon Garlic Chicken with a sweet and tangy glaze. Perfect for a quick, flavorful weeknight dinner that balances sweet, savory, and spicy flavors.

ingredients.item: chicken thighs, skin on and boneless

instructions: Season the chicken thigh with salt and pepper. Coat the chicken with cornstarch and shake off excess. Set aside.
In a pan, heat the oil over medium-high heat. Add the chicken skin side down and fry each side for 7 minutes or until golden brown. Set aside.
In a pan, heat the butter over medium heat. Once it is melted, saute the garlic until fragrant for 1 minute.
Add in soy sauce, mirin, honey, lemon juice, lemon zest, paprika, chili flakes and black pepper.
Cook the sauce until it thickens.
Add the chicken back to the pan and baste the chicken with the sauce.
Once it is done, serve with hot steamed rice, garnish with sesame seeds and chives, and enjoy!

title: Fricassee Tuna Melt
description: An unashamed beast of a sandwich in which Tunisian tuna fricassee meets the tuna melt, featuring double carbs, melted cheese, and a punchy harissa tapenade.

ingredients.item: tuna in olive oil (drained weight, reserve oil)

instructions: Put the tuna in a bowl, break it up with a spoon, then mix in the mayo, onion, a quarter-teaspoon of salt and a few grinds of black pepper.
Put all the tapenade ingredients in a food processor and blitz to a chunky paste.

Heat the 100ml olive oil in a large non-stick frying pan over medium-high heat. Fry the potato slices for 10-12 minutes, flipping often, until golden brown. Drain on kitchen paper and season with salt.
Spread each slice of bread with a quarter of the tapenade, then top with 50g of grated mozzarella.
Divide the tuna mix between two of the slices, then top with the fried potatoes and parsley leaves.
Close the sandwiches with the remaining bread slices (tapenade and cheese side down).
Return the frying pan to medium heat and fry each sandwich for about six minutes, flipping once halfway through, until golden and the cheese has melted.
Slice in half and serve immediately.

title: Sautéed Green Beans and Tofu
description: A quick and tasty side dish or main course featuring sautéed green beans and tofu with a savory soy-ginger glaze.
instructions: Clean the green beans and blanch them in boiling salted water for a few minutes until tender-crisp, then drain.
Cut the tofu into cubes and coat them evenly with the flour or cornstarch.
In a large pan or wok, sauté the tofu with a bit of oil until golden and crispy on all sides.
Add the blanched green beans to the pan along with the minced garlic and grated ginger.
Prepare the sauce by mixing the soy sauce, sugar, lime juice, and chili flakes in a small bowl.
Pour the sauce over the tofu and green beans, adding a splash of water if the mixture is too dry.
Toss everything over high heat for a couple of minutes until the sauce thickens and coats the ingredients perfectly.
Serve hot as a main or a flavorful side dish.

title: Pan-Fried Lemon Garlic Chicken
description: This Lemon Garlic Chicken is a healthy and refreshing chicken dish inspired by Malaysia's spicy lemon chicken. It is a pan-fried version of the popular dish, making it quick and easy for a lunchbox or dinner.
instructions: Marinate chicken with soy sauce, oyster sauce, dark soy sauce, honey, black pepper, and cornstarch. Set it aside for at least 5 minutes or when you prepare all the ingredients.
In a pan, drizzle in oil, and turn the heat to medium-high. Pan fry the chicken for 6-7 minutes or until the chicken is slightly brown.
Add in sliced onion and garlic, saute for 2-3 minutes or until onion has softened and become fragrant.
Turn the heat to high, and finish off by adding in sliced lemon and chopped cilantro. Saute on high heat for 1 minute.

title: Spaghetti alla Puttanesca
description: A classic Roman pasta full of character: salty, spicy, and deeply aromatic. Part of the Open Recipes project, easily adaptable for everyone.
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil and cook the spaghetti until al dente.
In a large pan, heat the olive oil and sauté the crushed garlic and chilli flakes.
Add the anchovy fillets and stir until they melt completely into the oil.
Add the Taggiasche olives and rinsed capers, letting them sizzle for a minute.
Pour in the tomato purée and simmer for about 8-10 minutes until the sauce thickens.
Drain the pasta and toss it directly into the sauce. Remove the garlic cloves before serving.
Garnish with fresh chopped parsley.
